results.title: Station in life
results.creator_credit: Television New Zealand, Frank Torley and John Gordon
results.brief_description: Shows some of the daily activities on a sheep property in the New Zealand high country. Notes the effect of the climate on the husbandry practices at this station and the changes in land use due to soil erosion.

results.title: Station 307
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum, Jacques-Yves Cousteau and Louis Malle
results.brief_description: Completely new techniques in the search for oil. The research vessel “Calypso”, equipped with special scientific gear, took a team of geologists and aqualung divers to survey the sea bed of the Persian Gulf in 1954. A submarine gravimeter is seen in action on the sea bed, and the divers, filmed at depths up to 100 feet, are shown taking samples from the floor of the Gulf. The samples are studied by geologists while the “Calypso” moves on to a new station.

results.title: Station 10
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson and Michael Scott
results.brief_description: This is a factual account of the life of policemen at one station in Montreal, drawn from sixty days and nights of on-the-spot filming. It is a view of life in the inner city that usually only the policeman has reason to encounter. There are ugly incidents here, but there is also reassurance that people in trouble do have help at hand, and that even for the law breaker the policeman does his work with impartiality, and usually with understanding and good humour. (Awards: Montreal; Melbourne.)

results.title: State plan for the development of intellectual disability services 1989-1992: a consumer's guide
results.creator_credit: CSV Community Services Victoria, IDS Public Education Unit and Les Greenhill
results.brief_description: A consumer’s overview of the State Plan for the development of Intellectual Disability Services which aims to help intellectually disabled people make decisions about their future regarding accomodation, employment, education, family support, recreation, rights and respite care. Discusses funding, changes in institutional care, assistance provided by the Community Living Support Service and the role of public education.

results.title: State opening of Parliament
results.brief_description: The first colored film of the annual ceremonial State Opening of Parliament. The State Drive from Buckingham Palace to Westminster and the assembly of the members of both Houses of Parliament and the heads of foreign missions. The Queen’s speech from the throne, where Her Majesty announces to the assembled Lords and Commons the legislation proposed by Her Ministers for the coming year.

results.title: State of the art. Part 6: Identity
results.brief_description: IDENTITY: The film observes artists in three very different situations. The international art world converges on the 1986 Sydney Biennale. A group of young black artists work on a mural in London.

results.title: State of the art. Part 4: Sexuality
results.brief_description: SEXUALITY: In a consideration of representation and identity, the film explores how artists can create alternatives to the conventional images of women and men in fashion, magazines and the media.

results.title: State of the art. Part 3: Imagination
results.brief_description: IMAGINATION: Investigating the linked themes of work, creativity and imagination, the film explores the creativity with five artists working in distinct and very different ways.

results.title: State of the art. Part 2: Value
results.brief_description: VALUE: On a journey through the art world in Germany and the United States, the film asks two closely related questions. How does a work of art acquire its aesthetic worth - who decided today whether it is good or not? And how does it gain financial worth - who says one canvas is worth more than a fortune and another next to nothing?
